intro: Argostemma muscicola, commonly known as the mossy argostemma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. The plant has thin, wiry stems and is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Argostemma muscicola is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
